data.title: A list of all the past Golden Boot winners in the Premier League
data.meta_description: The legendary Golden Boot winners in the Premier League are Thiery Henry and Allan Shearer. Besides winning the accolade, they lifted trophies with their teams
data.text:
The English Premier League is arguably the hardest football league for any talented striker to score. Many brilliant forwards who join EPL with high hopes often end up disappointed and hardly cope with its physical nature. Therefore, credit goes to the Golden Boot winners in the Premier League, who broke all barriers.

While the English top flight has produced many iconic strikers in world football, only a few have won the top scorer award. We have compiled a list of all Golden Boot winners the Premier League has produced since its inception in the 1992/93 season. Some have won it once, while others have multiple times.

Who has won the most Premier League Golden Boots?

Legendary Arsenal striker Thiery Henry is the most respected goalscorer in the league. His skills and vision helped propel the Gunners to success during his time. Meanwhile, Harry Kane and Mohamed Salah are among the latest Golden Boot winners Premier League fans love watching today.

Which goalkeeper has the most penalty saves of all time?

Football

PL Golden Boot History

The EPL was founded in 1992 and has developed into one of the most entertaining leagues, followed by billions of fans worldwide. Teddy Sheringham won the inaugural award of the top-scorer in 1992/1993 after emerging as the highest scorer. Since then, 25 players have won it as of the 2021/2022 season.

How is the Golden Boot winner decided?

The PL Golden Boot award goes to the player with the most goals at the end of a season. However, two or more players can share the prize if they tie on goals. The accolade has been shared four times since its inception. Meanwhile, in tournaments like the World Cup, when players score the same goals, assists are used to determine the winner.

A list of footballers with 500 or more goals: Goal-scoring machines

Football

First 10 Golden Boot winners in Premier League

Teddy Sheringham was the first player to win the award in the 1992/93 season. Sheringham won it as a Tottenham Hotspur player with 22 goals after joining the club from Nottingham Forest in 1992. Here is a list of the first Golden Boot winners in Premier League history:

Who won the Golden Boot in EPL 2022?

Liverpool's Mohamed Salah and Son Heung-min of Tottenham Hotspurs shared the accolade after scoring 23 goals each in the 2021/2022 season. Son, South Korea's captain, is the first Asian player to win the prestigious award.

Orlando Pirates legends: Top 10 all-time greats for The Sea Robbers

Football

Premier League Golden Boot winners 2020

Leicester City's Jamie Vardy walked away with the award in the 2019/20 season. He edged out Danny Ings of Southampton and Arsenal's Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, who both finished with 22 goals. Meanwhile, Tottenham's Harry Kane scooped the 2020/21 accolade after bagging 23 goals in the season.

Most Golden Boot winners in Premier League - Top 10

Besides winning the Golden Boot award, EPL's most prolific goal scorers also lifted various titles with their teams. However, some, including Harry Kane and Son Heung-min are trophyless. Below is a breakdown of the league's top 10 best scorers and titles won.

10. Jamie Vardy - 1

The English striker was one of the stars behind Leicester City's Premier League triumph in the 2015/2016 season. He was the club's best scorer of the season with 24 but missed out on the Golden Boot race to Harry Kane (25). Vardy won his only PL top-scorer award in the 2019/2020 season with 23 goals.

Ranking the 10 best Kylian Mbappe goals: Mbappeâ€™s glamorous goals

Football

9. Son Heung-min - 1

Son is one of the brightest and most talented strikers globally. He proved his doubters wrong by finishing top of the scoring chart in the 2021/2022 season, sharing the spot with Mohamed Salah (23 goals).

8. Robin van Persie - 2

Van Persie won the Golden Boot with Arsenal and Manchester United. He first won it with the Gunners after netting 30 times in the 2011/2012 season. His second came the following season after joining United, bagging 26 goals. The Dutch legend also won the EPL title with the Red Devils.

7. Michael Owen - 2

Owen is one of the youngest players to win the award. He won in 1997/1998 and 1998/1999, having netted 18 times, buts shared with other players on both occasions. Owen and Cristiano Ronaldo are the only two players to win the Ballon d'Or from the Premier League. He lifted the FA Cup, League Cup, and the UEFA Cup with Liverpool, among other titles.

Ranking the 10 greatest midfield trios of all time in football

Football

Has Drogba won the Golden Boot?

The former Chelsea striker was known for his physical strength, speed, and ability in the air. He is among the best strikers to play in the EPL, having won two top-scorer awards.

6. Didier Drogba - 2

Drogba won the PL Golden Boot in 2007 and 2010 and guided his team to four league titles. He also won the Champions League, among other domestic trophies. The Ivorian is considered among the best African players to play in the English top flight.

5. Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink - 2

Talk of one of the most lethal strikers of his generation, Hasselbaink boasts many accolades and records, including two PL Golden Boots. He is the only player, alongside Alan Shearer and Van Persie, to lift the award at two different clubs (Leeds United and Chelsea). Jimmy also played for Charlton Athletic and Middlesbrough.

4. Alan Shearer - 3

Portugal World Cup Squad 2022: Is Cristiano Ronaldo playing this World Cup?

Football

Shearer, an inductee into the Premier League Hall of Fame, is considered the best EPL striker of his generation. He won two Golden Boots at Blackburn Rovers and one as a Newcastle United player. Shearer also lifted the 1994/95 EPL with Blackburn.

The England legend is also the all-time Premier League top scorer with 260 goals. Wayne Rooney is second with 208, while Harry Kane is closing in with 200 as of 6 February 2023.

3. Mohamed Salah - 3

The Liverpool winger won the EPL top scorer award in 2017/2018, 2018/2019, and 2021/2022 seasons. His 32 goals in the 2017/2018 season put him among the highest scorers in a league season. Salah's Golden Boot record makes him one of the best strikers in PL history. He also won one EPL title and a Champions League with the Reds.

2. Harry Kane - 3

Despite winning three Golden Boot awards (2015-16, 2016-17, 2020-21), Kane is yet to lift a trophy with his club, Tottenham Hotspurs. He has excellent passing and playmaking skills, making him one of the best strikers of his generation. Harry Kane has broken many goal-scoring records for club and country.

Spain World Cup squad 2022: Which players will represent the Red Fury this World Cup?

Football

1. Thiery Henry - 4

The French legend is the only player to have won the PL Golden Boot four times. His career-best was in 2003 when he netted 30 times in the league during the Invincibles era. Henry won a league title with the Gunners, among other domestic titles. He was inducted into the PL Hall of Fame alongside Allan Shearer in April 2021.

Golden Boot winners Premier League 2023

The battle for the 2022/23 EPL top scorer award is going on, with Manchester City's Erling Haaland leading in the race. The Norwegian has 25 goals in 19 games as of 6 February 2023. He has scored in 14 out of the 19 matches. Harry Kane is following closely with 16 goals in 21 games, while Brentford's Ivan Toney has 13 in 18 appearances.

Many football fanatics expect Haaland to break the Premier League record for most goals in a season (34) by Andy Cole and Alan Shearer. The City striker only needs to score ten goals in the 18 matches to eclipse the mark.

Germany World Cup squad 2022: Which players will be representing Germany this World Cup?

Football

As observed, the list of Golden Boot winners in the Premier League history consists of purely strikers and forwards. It is not surprising because their prime duty is scoring goals for their teams. However, Shearer's record of 34 goals in a season remains the ultimate target for many strikers of the current generation.
